file_content.text: What? How is this possible? You're stronger than any I have faced....
Forgive me, my--my lord. Take the artifact. Just let me live and carry on the cult in your name.
I hate to break it to you, Paladius, but Darth Zash promised the cult to us. You're done.
You're very trusting, Destris, but surely, my lord sees the advantage of leaving the cult in my hands--think of what I could accomplish on your behalf.
My lord, please--can Paladius really be trusted?
He is Sith, and far more worthy than you lot.
He's superior to you.
He's also lying scum who'll stab you in the back first chance he gets. We had a deal.
Ha. These weaklings would run the cult into the ground within a year.
No, he must die. [Kill him]
Aaagh!
Stop your prattling! This cult is mine and mine alone.
Shut up, all of you!
With all respect, Sith, I know this Eye of Tulak is only one piece of the artifact you seek.
Do you intend to give up your search and stay on Nar Shaddaa? Your master won't allow it.
But simply hand control of the cult over to me, and I will be at your beck and call.
Nicely argued, Paladius.
The cult's yours, then.
Thank you, my lord. You are most gracious and most wise.
If you so much as think a thought contrary to my will, I will rip you open.
If you obey, it's yours.
Thank you, my lord. Rest assured that all my thoughts are now your own.
Myself--and the cult--will assist you whenever you need.
You can't do this! We had Darth Zash's word!
I was not consulted in that deal.
You and Zash had a deal.
I have no further use for you.
That's enough. [Kill Destris]
Aaagh!
My lord! How could you--you... I thought....
Dear Rylee. You will have to be punished, of course, but if you accept your punishment, I don't see why we can't let bygones be bygones.
Aaagh!
You answer to Paladius now. You will obey in silence, or suffer.
Shut up! [Shock him]
Aaagh! Y--yes, my lord. I'm sorry.
My lord--but... but....
How wonderful to have you back under my command, Destris, Rylee.
Aaagh!
Aaagh!
Call on me, and your cult will be waiting.
Darth Zash promised the cult for Destris and Rylee, and her word is mine.
No, I keep my word. [Kill him]
You foolish ideal--aagh!
Well, that was every bit as satisfying as I expected. We're in your debt, Rylee and me.
Only, the thing is, everyone in the cult looks up to you now...
You will run this cult to my exact specifications.
You are my mouthpiece.
Don't worry about it. You can count on us.
I got what I wanted out of the bargain. You figure out how to run the cult.
I don't care.
Um, yes, my lord. I'm sure we'll figure something out.
I guess I should go rally the cultists before they lose their fervor. Thanks again.
Um, Sith? I'm grateful for all you've done--but I did wonder....
You're leaving now, right? I mean... what happens to... us... when you're gone?
Of course we'll keep in touch--but, you know, space is pretty big, and there's all that interference....
[Lie] I'll be sure to call.
Right. Good. Well, I look forward to hearing from you then, but I understand. Yeah.
Good luck out there--finding those artifacts. Or whatever it is you're doing.
I'll visit you as often as I can, I promise.
Don't worry.
Really? Great. That's really great. I'm, well, I look forward to it.
Good luck--and don't be too long between visits, okay? Okay.
There was never any "us."
Us? You're kidding.
Oh. I'm sorry--I thought... well, thank you anyway, for saving our lives. I guess.
Yes, thank you, Sith. We'd still be hiding in that hole if it weren't for you.
Sith! Destron! Rachel! I'm so glad you've come. You have made a wonderful decision.
Can I offer you anything? A drink? And don't mind Var-Nok and Shar-Nok; they never leave my side.
You know exactly what you can offer me.
Just the artifact.
So confident. So amazingly confident.
Come to think of it, my lips are a bit parched.
I'd love a drink.
So trusting. So marvelously trusting.
I was prepared to fight through your welcoming committee.
I expected an attack.
Oh, Sith, you've proven yourself more than a match for anyone I'd throw at you.
But I dare say, you've gravely underestimated me. That painful twisting you feel in your gut is your essence draining, rather rapidly.
And that hollow, sinking feeling? Your connection to the Force being severed. Soon you will be no more powerful than little Denton here, or Ramona.
How are you doing this?
I don't understand.
There are secrets known to the Sith that you have only dreamt of--this is one, and your artifact is another.
I can still kill you.
For that, you will suffer!
Death is too easy. [Shock him]
Ha! Not so powerful anymore, are we?
Greater Sith than you have fallen before me. Did you think you were the first to try to steal my cult?
I could choke the life out of you right now, but since you seem so very eager--let's settle this with lightsabers.
There is only one law, for the weak as well as the strong, and that is power!
For too long, the weak of Nar Shaddaa have grown soft in the luxury of their towers, while the strong have wallowed in chains.
But I tell you--united, there is no law that can stop you. Take back what is yours!
Yeah!
Never a truer word spoken, my friend.
Well said.
But I like the weak!
Boo!
What have you done for me lately?
Why should I listen to you?
There are those who would tell you lies. Who spread rumors and false promises!
Already some among you are lost--having chosen the path of weakness.
But you must shun this false messenger. The weak fear your growing strength and have sent him to break it.
But you must shun this false messenger. The weak fear your growing strength and have sent her to break it.
I come on my own power, under my own authority.
No one sent me.
He's the one who oppresses you, taking your money and giving nothing in return.
Paladius is weak!
What makes you worthy of leading such a strong people, Paladius?
Show me your strength!
Ah, the deceiver shows his face.
Ah, the deceiver shows her face.
Behold, my children! Look how pathetic--how easily crushed by your collective might!
The very ground you stand on responds to my will. Can Paladius do this?
Paladius is nothing. [Signal]
That's no way to greet a guest, Lord Paladius. Do you fear what I have to say?
Hear me out!
Fear? We do not fear anything, do we, my children?
You don't need to be slaves to anyone, not the ganglords, not Paladius. You can be free.
Paladius rules by fear.
Lies! Who drove the gangs out of the lower districts? Who gave you homes and protected you?
You are a mighty blade, my children. But one that needs a great warrior to wield.
I am that warrior. Together we lay waste to our enemies!
I don't need weapons--my power is real.
You're a fake. [Signal]
Yawn. That's plenty. [Signal.]
You're just a weapon to him--an object to be used and discarded.
He doesn't care about you.
You're a deceiver!
Yeah! Get out of here! We serve Paladius!
Wait, maybe there's something to this Sith. She defeated Saben, didn't she?
Wait, maybe there's something to this Sith. She cured the Rot, didn't she?
Wait, maybe there's something to this Sith. He defeated Saben, didn't he?
Wait, maybe there's something to this Sith. He cured the Rot, didn't he?
I command the planet to move, and it moves!
The ground obeys me. [Signal]
I will bring this building down if you don't bow to me!
Nothing. [Signal]
With power such as this, you need never bow to another fool like Paladius again.
I can make you free. [Signal]
Aaaaah!
What kind of power is this?
The world is ending!
Don't be fooled! It's a trick! Attack the deceiver! Attack!
Ha! Thank you, Sith. Your artifact, as promised--and this special signaling device, as a sign of good faith between us.
You handle the cult, but the income from cult donations goes to me.
I only care about the money.
Of course, my lord. We'll wire the credits to you regularly.
And don't let them forget it.
